oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Florence Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Studio photograph of Florence Service taken as a young woman. At the bottom of the picture frame is the studio name - the Obenaus Studios Albany, Troy & Schenectady N.Y.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: The Obenaus Studios Albany, Troy & Schenectady N.Y.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burlington Traction Company Trolley
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a trolley. Trolley has "Burlington Traction Company" and "50" written on the side. Resting on the ground in front of the trolley is a sign that says, "Built By J.M. Jones' Sons Company".

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hudson Valley Railway Trolley
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a trolley in Watervliet, New York (then West Troy). This trolley ran from Albany to Warrensburg New York. Trolley has "Hudson Valley Railway" and "43" written on the side. Resting on the ground in front of the trolley is a sign that says, "Built By J.M. Jones' Sons West Troy N.Y.".
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hudson River Steamboat Alexander Hamilton
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photo of the Hudson River Steamboat Alexander Hamilton taken from aboard another boat. It remains (2013) sunk at its pier in Monmouth County, New Jersey, since 1977. The photo is one of several presumably taken on the same voyage about 1937-39. On Velox photograph paper.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt Presidential yacht Potomac at Poughkeepsie NY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photo of the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Presidential yacht Potomac at Poughkeepsie presumably taken from aboard another boat. "Potomac" written in a childish hand at tp of photograph. The photo is one of several presumably taken on the same voyage about 1937-39. Poughkeepsie was the port used several times from 1937 to 1939 when President Roosevelt visited Hyde Park. On Velox photograph paper.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Congress Street Bridge, Watervliet, NY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photo of the Congress Street bridge, a highway and wagon bridge originally built in 1874. It was rebuilt sometime later, about 1927, still as a truss swing bridge. In 12971 it was replaced with a deck-girder fixed span bridge. Troy-Watervliet Swing Bridge.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bridges;

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1913 Flood in Watervliet, NY - 14th Street & 1st Avenue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This black and white photograph contains a view of the flooded intersetion of 14th Street and 1st Avenue in Watervliet, N.Y. The water is completely obscuring the sidewalk and road and has reached several windows. In the distance there is a sign on a building that reads: Troy Cold Storage (illegible) Butter, Eggs and (illegible).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stevens, Marjorie
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Watervliet (N.Y.); Floods; Natural disasters;

The water is completely obscuring the sidewalk and road and has reached several windows. Written on the bottom of the photo is: 19th & Broadway. Watervliet. Mar.28.1913.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1913 Flood in Watervliet, NY - Second Avenue
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This black and white photograph contains a view of the flooded Second Avenue on the left, and the canal on the right in Watervliet N.Y. The water is completely obscuring the sidewalk, road, and edges of the canal and has reached several windows.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1913 Flood in Watervliet, NY - Unknown Road
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This black and white photograph contains a view of a flooded street in Watervliet, N.Y. The water obscures most of the road; in the distance a bridge rises out of the water. Four people are in a boat traveling through the middle of the intersection. On the right, a sign can be seen that says: T. Richardson's Sons Coal.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1887 Business Directory of Troy, West Troy, Green Island & Cohoes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This document is a directory of the businesses in Troy, West Troy, Green Island & Cohoes in 1887. In addition to the directory, this document contains advertisements from many of these businesses. These advertisements have an interesting layout, where every line uses a different typeface.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Joseph Rippey & Co.
